definitionList.name: RESET
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the gNB-CU-CP
and the gNB-CU-UP and is used to request that the E1 interface, or parts of the
E1 interface, to be reset.
definitionList.direction: Direction: gNB-CU-CP → gNB-CU-UP and gNB-CU-UP → gNB-CU-CP

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of UE-associated logical E1-connections allowed to reset in one message.
  Value is 65536.

definitionList.name: RESET ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the gNB-CU-CP
and the gNB-CU-UP as a response to a RESET message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: gNB-CU-UP → gNB-CU-CP and gNB-CU-CP → gNB-CU-UP.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of UE-associated logical E1-connections allowed to reset in one message.
  Value is 65536.

definitionList.name: ERROR INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the gNB-CU-CP
and the gNB-CU-UP and is used to indicate that some error has been detected in
the node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: gNB-CU-CP → gNB-CU-UP and gNB-CU-UP → gNB-CU-CP

elementList.name: Transaction ID
elementList.description: This IE shall be ignored if received in UE associated signalling message.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP E1 SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
transfer information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-UP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Supported PLMNs
elementList.description: Supported PLMNs

elementList.name: Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs.

elementList.name: NR CGI Support List
elementList.description: Supported cells.

elementList.name: QoS Parameters Support List
elementList.description: Supported QoS parameters.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of Supported PLMN Ids. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP E1 SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
transfer information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP E1 SETUP FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
indicate E1 Setup failure.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP E1 SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
transfer information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP E1 SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
transfer information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-UP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Supported PLMNs
elementList.description: Supported PLMNs

elementList.name: Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs.

elementList.name: NR CGI Support List
elementList.description: Supported cells.

elementList.name: QoS Parameters Support List
elementList.description: Supported QoS parameters.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of Supported PLMN Ids. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP E1 SETUP FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to indicate
E1 Setup failure.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP CONFIGURATION UPDATE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
transfer updated information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-UP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Supported PLMNs
elementList.description: Supported PLMNs

elementList.name: Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs.

elementList.name: NR CGI Support List
elementList.description: Supported cells.

elementList.name: QoS Parameters Support List
elementList.description: Supported QoS parameters.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of Supported PLMN Ids. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by a gNB-CU-CP to a
gNB-CU-UP to acknowledge update of information for a TNL association.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
indicate gNB-CU-UP Configuration Update failure.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP CONFIGURATION UPDATE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
transfer updated information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP Name
elementList.description: Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP TNLA To Add Item IEs
gNB-CU-CP TNLA To Remove Item IEs
TNLA Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Address of the gNB-CU.

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP TNLA To Update Item IEs
TNLA Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Address of the gNB-CU.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  numbers of TNL Associations between the gNB-CU-CP and the gNB-CU-UP. Value is
  32.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by a gNB-CU-UP to a
gNB-CU-CP to acknowledge update of information for a TNL association.

elementList.name: TNLA Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Address of the gNB-CU

elementList.name: gNB-CU-CP TNLA Failed to Setup List
gNB-CU-CP TNLA Failed To Setup Item IEs
TNLA Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Address of the gNB-CU

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  numbers of TNL Associations between the gNB-CU-CP and the gNB-CU-UP. Value is
  32.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-CP CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
indicate gNB-CU-CP Configuration Update failure.

definitionList.name: E1 RELEASE REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the gNB-CU-CP
and the gNB-CU-UP and is used to request the release of the E1 interface.
definitionList.direction: Direction: gNB-CU-CP → gNB-CU-UP and gNB-CU-UP → gNB-CU-CP

definitionList.name: E1 RELEASE RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the gNB-CU-CP
and the gNB-CU-UP as a response to an E1 RELEASE REQUEST message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: gNB-CU-UP → gNB-CU-CP and gNB-CU-CP → gNB-CU-UP.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP STATUS INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
indicate to the gNB-CU-CP its status of overload.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
request the gNB-CU-UP to setup a bearer context.

elementList.name: UE DL Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
UE DL Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: The Bit Rate is a portion of the UE’s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate, and is enforced by the gNB-CU-UP node.

elementList.name: UE Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to UE.

elementList.name: Bearer Context Status Change
elementList.description: Indicates the status of the Bearer Context

elementList.name: S1 UL UP Transport Layer Information
Data Forwarding Information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Cell Group Information
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-UP shall provide one UL UP Transport Layer Information Item per cell group entry.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: Existing Allocated S1 DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Resource To Setup List
PDU Session Resource To Setup Item
PDU Session Resource DL Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE shall be present when at least one Non-GBR QoS Flows is being setup.

elementList.name: NG UL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Request
PDU Session Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to PDU Session.

elementList.name: Existing Allocated NG DL UP Transport Layer Information
Cell Group Information
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-UP shall provide one UL UP Transport Layer Information Item per cell group entry.

elementList.name: QoS Flows Information To Be Setup
DRB Data forwarding information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Contains the PDCP SN Status at setup after Resume.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
confirm the setup of the requested bearer context.

elementList.name: S1 DL UP Transport Layer Information
Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: NG DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Data forwarding information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT SETUP FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
indicate that the setup of the bearer context was unsuccessful.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT MODIFICATION REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
request the gNB-CU-UP to setup a bearer context.

elementList.name: UE DL Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
UE DL Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: The Bit Rate is a portion of the UE’s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate, and is enforced by the gNB-CU-UP node.

elementList.name: Bearer Context Status Change
elementList.description: Indicates the status of the Bearer Context

elementList.name: New UL TNL Information Required
elementList.description: Indicates that new UL TNL information has been requested to be provided.

elementList.name: UE Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to UE.

elementList.name: Data Discard Required
elementList.description: Indicate to discard the DL user data in case of RAN paging failure.

elementList.name: S1 UL UP Transport Layer Information
Data Forwarding Information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Cell Group Information
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-UP shall provide one UL UP Transport Layer Information Item per cell group entry

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: S1 UL UP Transport Layer Information
Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding info to the source gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Request
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-CP requests the gNB-CU-UP to provide the PDCP SN Status in the response message.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Providing SN Status information to the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource To Setup List
PDU Session Resource To Setup Item
PDU Session Resource DL Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE shall be present when Non-GBR QoS Flows are setting up.

elementList.name: NG UL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDU Session Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to PDU Session.

elementList.name: Cell Group Information
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-UP shall provide one UL UP Transport Layer Information Item per cell group entry.

elementList.name: QoS Flows Information To Be Setup
DRB Data forwarding information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding info from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Provides the PDCP SN Status at setup after Resume to the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource To Modify List
PDU Session Resource To Modify Item
PDU Session Resource DL Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
NG UL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding information from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding information to the source gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDU Session Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to PDU Session.

elementList.name: DRB Data Forwarding Information Request
elementList.description: Requesting forwarding information from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Provides the PDCP SN Status at setup after Resume to the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Data forwarding information Response
elementList.description: Providing forwarding information to the source gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Request
elementList.description: The gNB-CU-CP requests the gNB-CU-UP to provide the PDCP SN Status in the response message.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Provides the PDCP SN Status to the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Flow Mapping Information
elementList.description: Overrides previous mapping information.

elementList.name: DRB Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Included if the Activity Notification Level is set to DRB.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource To Remove List
PDU Session Resource To Remove Item

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT MODIFICATION RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
confirm the modification of the requested bearer context.

elementList.name: S1 DL UP Transport Layer Information
Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Provides forwarding information from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: S1 DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Provides the PDCP SN Status from the source gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: UL UP Parameters
elementList.description: Carries the UL UP parameters for newly added cell groups.

elementList.name: NG DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Response
elementList.description: Provides forwarding information from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRB Data forwarding information Response
elementList.description: Provides forwarding information from the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: NG DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Data Forwarding Information Response
PDCP SN Status Information
elementList.description: Provides PDCP SN Status to the target gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: UL UP Parameters
elementList.description: Carries the UL UP parameters for newly added cell groups.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Failed To Modify List
PDU Session Resource Failed To Modify Item

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT MODIFICATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
indicate that the modification of the bearer context was unsuccessful.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT MODIFICATION REQUIRED
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
inform the gNB-CU-CP that a modification of a bearer context is required (e.g.,
due to local problems at the gNB-CU-UP).

elementList.name: S1 DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Resource To Modify List
PDU Session Resource To Modify Item
NG DL UP Transport Layer Information
PDU Session Resource To Remove List
PDU Session Resource To Remove Item

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT MODIFICATION CONFIRM
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
confirm the modification of the requested bearer context.

elementList.name: Cell Group Information
elementList.description: Included if the gNB-CU-CP was unable to change cell group related information as requested in the gNB-CU-UP Cell Group Related Configuration IE (e.g., UL Configuration).

elementList.name: Cell Group Information
elementList.description: Included if the gNB-CU-CP was unable to change cell group related information as requested in the gNB-CU-UP Cell Group Related Configuration IE (e.g., UL Configuration).

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT RELEASE COMMAND
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-CP to
command the gNB-CU-UP to release an UE-associated logical E1 connection.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT RELEASE COMPLETE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
confirm the release of the UE-associated logical E1 connection.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT RELEASE REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
request the release of an UE-associated logical E1 connection.

elementList.name: PDCP DL Count
elementList.description: PDCP count for next DL packet to be assigned.

elementList.name: PDCP UL Count
elementList.description: PDCP count for first un-acknowledged UL packet.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: BEARER CONTEXT INACTIVITY NOTIFICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
provide information about the UE activity to the gNB-CU-CP.

elementList.name: DRB Activity List
elementList.description: Shall be used if the Activity Notification Level IE is set as “DRB” in BEARER CONTEXT SETUP Request message

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Activity List
elementList.description: Shall be used if the Activity Notification Level IE is set as “PDU Session” in the BEARER CONTEXT SETUP Request message

elementList.name: UE Activity
elementList.description: Shall be used if the Activity Notification Level IE is set as “UE” in the BEARER CONTEXT SETUP Request message

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of DRB for a UE, the maximum value is 32.

Maximum
  no. of PDU Sessions for a UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: DL DATA NOTIFICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
provide information about the DL data detection to the gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: DATA USAGE REPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
report data volumes.

definitionList.name: GNB-CU-UP COUNTER CHECK REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with the DRBs established
in the gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject to Counter Check List
DRBs Subject to Counter Check Item
PDCP UL Count
elementList.description: Indicates the value of uplink COUNT associated to this DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP DL Count
elementList.description: Indicates the value of downlink COUNT associated to this DRB.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject to Counter Check List
DRBs Subject to Counter Check Item
PDCP UL Count
elementList.description: Indicates the value of uplink COUNT associated to this DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP DL Count
elementList.description: Indicates the value of downlink COUNT associated to this DRB.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of DRBs for a UE. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: UL DATA NOTIFICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
provide information about the UL data detection to the gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: MR-DC DATA USAGE REPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the gNB-CU-UP to
report data volumes when the UE is connected to the 5GC.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Data Usage List
PDU Session Resource Data Usage Item

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of PDU sessions. Value is 256

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely
identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Cause IE is to
indicate the reason for a particular event for the E1AP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Unspecified, Unknown or already allocated gNB-CU-CP UE E1AP ID, Unknown or already allocated gNB-CU-UP UE E1AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of UE E1AP ID, Interaction with other procedure, PDCP Count Wrap Around, Not supported QCI value, Not supported 5QI value, Encryption algorithms not supported, Integrity protection algorithms not supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple DRB ID Instances, Unknown DRB ID, Invalid QoS combination, Procedure cancelled, Normal release, No radio resources available, Action desirable for radio reasons, Resources not available for the slice, PDCP configuration not supported, …, UE DL maximum integrity protected data rate reason, UP integrity protection failure, Release due to Pre-Emption)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, …)

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the gNB-CU-UP or the gNB-CU-CP when parts of a received message have
not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical
errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not
comprehended or were missing. The conditions for inclusion of the Transaction
ID IE are described in clause 10.

For further details on how to use the Criticality
Diagnostics IE, (see clause 10).

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of IE errors allowed to be reported with a single message. The value for
  maxnoofErrors is 256.

definitionList.name: gNB-CU-CP UE E1AP ID
descriptionList:
The gNB-CU-CP UE E1AP ID uniquely identifies
the UE association over the E1 interface within the gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: gNB-CU-UP UE E1AP ID
descriptionList:
The gNB-CU-UP UE E1AP ID uniquely
identifies the UE association over the E1 interface within the gNB-CU-UP.

definitionList.name: Time To wait
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList:
This
information element indicates the PLMN Identity.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: Slice Support List
descriptionList:
This
IE indicates the list of supported slices.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of signalled slice support items. Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: S-NSSAI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI.

definitionList.name: Security Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides the information for
configuring UP ciphering and/or integrity protection.

definitionList.name: Cell Group Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides information about the cell
group(s) (i.e., radio leg(s)) that are part of the DRB.

elementList.name: Cell Group ID
elementList.description: Cell group ID as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [21].

elementList.name: UL Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates whether the Cell Group is used for UL traffic.

elementList.name: RAT Type
elementList.description: Indicates the RAT.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of cell groups for a DRB. Value is 4.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow List
descriptionList:
This IE includes a list of QoS Flows that
are identified by the QoS Flow Identifier.

elementList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows in a PDU Session.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UP Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE provides information related to a
DRB configured in the gNB-CU-UP.

elementList.name: Cell Group ID
elementList.description: Cell group ID as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of UP parameters (e.g., GTP tunnels) for a DRB. Value is 8

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList:
The NR
Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify a cell.

definitionList.name: gNB-CU-UP ID
descriptionList:
The gNB-CU-UP ID uniquely identifies the
gNB-CU-UP at least within a
gNB-CU-CP.

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList: This IE uniquely identifies a DRB for a UE.

elementList.name: DRB ID
elementList.description: Corresponds to the DRB-Identity defined in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: E-UTRAN QoS
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS to be applied to a
DRB for EN-DC case.

elementList.name: QCI
elementList.description: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [11]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [12].

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Allocation and Retention Priority
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Allocation and Retention Priority

elementList.name: GBR QoS Information
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise.

definitionList.name: E-UTRAN Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio
Access Bearer.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [11]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum and
guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [11].

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided
by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum
or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: PDU Session ID
descriptionList:
This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE.
The definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [20].

definitionList.name: PDU Session Type
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the PDU Session Type as specified
in TS 23.501 [20].

definitionList.name: Security Indication
descriptionList:
This IE contains the user plane integrity protection
indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the
requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for corresponding PDU Session
Resources, respectively.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply or shall not apply for the concerned PDU Session Resource.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply or shall not apply for the concerned PDU Session Resource.

elementList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: If present, this is the value received from the CN for the overall UE capability.

conditionList.explanation:
This
  IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection Indication IE within
  the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or
  “preferred”.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Identifier
descriptionList:
This IE
identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow
Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows in a PDU Session.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS parameters to be
applied to a QoS Flow.

elementList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS Flows only.

elementList.name: Reflective QoS Attribute
elementList.description: Details in TS 23.501 [20]. This IE applies to Non-GBR flows only and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Additional QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU Session.

elementList.name: RDI
elementList.description: Indicates whether Reflective QoS flow to DRB mapping should be applied.

definitionList.name: Non Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the QoS Characteristics
for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20]. When included overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR QoS Flows only. For details see TS 23.501 [20]. When included overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20]. When included overrides standardized or pre-configured value. If the 5QI refers to a non-delay critical QoS flow the IE shall be ignored.

definitionList.name: Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the QoS Characteristics
for a Non-standardised or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Delay Critical
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: For details see TS 23.501 [20]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to “delay critical” and shall be ignored otherwise.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS
  Flow Level QoS Parameters IE.

definitionList.name: NG-RAN Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
of a QoS flow compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of
NG-RAN resources.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE defines the relative importance of a resource request (see TS 23.501 [20]). Usage: Values are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., with 1 as the highest priority and 15 as the lowest priority. Further usage is defined in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows. Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flows or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to pre-emption of other QoS flows. Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. The Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates QoS parameters for a GBR
QoS flow for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided there is data to deliver) in DL. Details in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided there is data to deliver). Details in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Details in TS 23.501 [20].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Details in TS 23.501 [20].

definitionList.name: Security Algorithm
descriptionList:
This IE defines the type of ciphering
algorithm and/or integrity protection used for the DRBs.

elementList.name: Ciphering Algorithm
elementList.description: As defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Algorithm
elementList.description: As defined in TS 33.501 [13]. For E-UTRAN, this IE shall not be included.

definitionList.name: User Plane Security Keys
descriptionList:
This IE contains the ciphering and/or
integrity protection keys generated by the gNB-CU-CP.

elementList.name: Encryption Key
elementList.description: As defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Key
elementList.description: As defined in TS 33.501 [13]. For E-UTRAN, this IE shall not be included.

definitionList.name: UL Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE includes the UL configuration for
the DRB and the corresponding Cell Groups.

elementList.name: UL Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates the UL configuration for a Cell Group that is part of a DRB. “no data” means that the Cell Group is not used for UL data. “shared” means that the Cell Group is used for UL data together with at least another Cell Group. “only” means that only this Cellg Group is used for UL data.

definitionList.name: gNB-CU-UP Cell Group Related Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE provides information related to a
cell group that the gNB-CU-UP is allowed to change.

elementList.name: Cell Group ID
elementList.description: Cell group ID as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). Used to identify the Cell Group to modify. In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver.

elementList.name: UL Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates whether the Cell Group is used for UL traffic.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of UP parameters (e.g., GTP
  tunnels) for a DRB. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: PDCP Count
descriptionList: This IE include the PDCP Count information.

elementList.name: PDCP SN
elementList.description: The PDCP SN Size is provided in the PDCP Configuration IE.

elementList.name: HFN
elementList.description: The PDCP SN Size is provided in the PDCP Configuration IE.

definitionList.name: NR CGI Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of supported NR
CGIs.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of supported NR CGIs. Value is 512. This range may be redefined.

definitionList.name: QoS Parameters Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of supported QoS
parameters.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum
  no. of supported E-UTRAN QoS parameters. Value is 256. This range may be redefined.

Maximum
  no. of supported NG-RAN QoS parameters. Value is 256. This range may be
  redefined.

definitionList.name: PDCP Configuration
descriptionList: This IE carries the PDCP configuration.

elementList.name: PDCP SN UL Size
elementList.description: Indicates the PDCP SN UL size in bits. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: PDCP SN DL Size
elementList.description: Indicates the PDCP SN DL size in bits. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: RLC mode
elementList.description: Indicates the RLC mode for the DRB. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: PDCP Duplication
elementList.description: Indicates whether PDCP duplication is to be configured for the DRB.

elementList.name: PDCP Re-establishment
elementList.description: Indicates PDCP entity re-establishment to be triggered as defined in TS 38.323 [17]

elementList.name: PDCP Data Recovery
elementList.description: Indicates PDCP data recovery to be triggered as defined in TS 38.323 [17]

elementList.name: Duplication Activation
elementList.description: Information on the initial state of DL PDCP duplication

elementList.name: Out Of Order Delivery
elementList.description: Indicates whether or not outOfOrderDelivery specified in TS 38.323 [17] is configured. Out of order delivery is configured only when the radio bearer is established.

definitionList.name: SDAP Configuration
descriptionList: This IE carries the SDAP configuration.

elementList.name: Default DRB
elementList.description: Indicates whether or not this is the default DRB for the PDU Session Resource. For more information see SDAP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: SDAP Header UL
elementList.description: Indicates whether or not a SDAP header is present for UL data on this DRB. For more information see SDAP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: SDAP Header DL
elementList.description: Indicates whether or not a SDAP header is present for DL data on this DRB. For more information see SDAP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: ROHC Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE carries the ROCH parameters for
header compressions.

elementList.name: Choice ROHC Parameters
elementList.description: For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: max CID
elementList.description: See description of maxCID inTS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: ROHC Profiles
elementList.description: Bitmap with supported UE profiles, bit 0 (LSB 0) = profile0x0001, bit 1 = profile0x0002, bit 2 = profile0x0003, bit 3 = profile0x0004, bit 4 = profile0x0006, bit 5 = profile0x0101, bit 6 = profile0x0102, bit 7 = profile0x0103, bit 8 = profile0x0104. See description of supportedROHC-Profiles in PDCP-Parameters in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Continue ROHC
elementList.description: See description of drb-ContinueROHC inTS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: max CID
elementList.description: See description of maxCID inTS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: ROHC Profiles
elementList.description: Bitmap with supported UE profiles, bit 4 = profile0x0006. See description of supportedROHC-Profiles in PDCP-Parameters in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Continue ROHC
elementList.description: See description of drb-ContinueROHC inTS 38.331 [10]

definitionList.name: T-Reordering Timer
descriptionList: This IE indicates the t-Reordering timer.

elementList.name: T-Reordering Timer
elementList.description: Indicates the t-Reordering UL timer. The values are expressed in ms. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Discard Timer
descriptionList: This IE indicates PDCP discard timer.

elementList.name: Discard Timer
elementList.description: Indicates the PDCP discard timer. The values are expressed in ms. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: UL Data Split Threshold
descriptionList: This IE indicates UL data split threshold.

elementList.name: UL Data Spit Threshold
elementList.description: Indicates the UL data split threshold. The values are expressed in bits. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Data Usage Report List
descriptionList:
This IE provides information on the data
usage for the UE, e.g., secondary NR RAT in EN-DC as
specified in TS 37.340 [19].

elementList.name: Start timestamp
elementList.description: Encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [14]. It indicates the UTC time when the recording of the Data Volume was started.

elementList.name: End timestamp
elementList.description: Encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [14]. It indicates the UTC time when the recording of the Data Volume was ended.

elementList.name: Usage count UL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

elementList.name: Usage count DL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of DRBs. Value is 32.

Maximum no. of time reporting periods. Value is
  2.

definitionList.name: Flow Failed List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of QoS flows with a
cause value. It is used for example to indicate failed QoS flow(s) or QoS flow(s)
to be released.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows in a PDU Session.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS
Flow.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Packet Delay Budget
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget
for a QoS Flow.

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in unit of 0.5ms.

definitionList.name: Packet Error Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for
a QoS Flow.

elementList.name: Scalar
elementList.description: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar x 10-k where k is the Exponent.

definitionList.name: Averaging Window
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Averaging Window for
a QoS Flow.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Unit: ms. The default value is 2000ms.

definitionList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst
Volume for QoS Flow.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Unit: byte.

definitionList.name: Priority Level
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Priority Level for a
QoS Flow.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

definitionList.name: Security Result
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether the security
policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE
is performed or not.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU Session Resource.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU Session Resource.

definitionList.name: Transaction ID
descriptionList:
The Transaction ID IE uniquely
identifies a procedure among all ongoing parallel procedures of the same type
initiated by the same protocol peer. Messages belonging to the same procedure
shall use the same Transaction ID. The Transaction ID is determined by the
initiating peer of a procedure.

definitionList.name: Inactivity timer
descriptionList: This IE indicates the inactivity timer.

elementList.name: Inactivity Timer
elementList.description: Indicates the inactivity timer. The values are expressed in seconds.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority Indicator (PPI)
descriptionList:
The Paging Policy Indicator is used for
paging policy differentiation (see details in TS 23.501 [20]).

definitionList.name: gNB-CU-UP Capacity
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the relative processing
capacity of an gNB-CU-UP with respect to other gNB-CU-UPs in order to
load-balance among different gNB-CU-UPs.

definitionList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE
as defined in TS 38.300 [8].

elementList.name: Maximum IP rate
elementList.description: Defines the upper bound of the aggregated data rate of user plane integrity protected data. This limit applies to both UL and DL independently.

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Status Information
descriptionList: This IE contains information about PDCP PDU transfer status of a DRB.

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node (handover) or the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (dual connectivity) should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Mapping List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of DRBs containing
information about the mapped QoS flows.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS
  flows allowed within one PDU Session.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or only the downlink of a QoS flow is
mapped to a DRB.

elementList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Size
descriptionList: This IE carries the PDCP SN Size.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Size
elementList.description: Indicates the PDCP SN size in bits. For more information see PDCP-Config IE in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Network Instance
descriptionList:
This IE provides the network instance to be
used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource
as described in [20].

definitionList.name: MR-DC Usage Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides information on the data
usage for the UE connected to 5GC, e.g., secondary RAT in MR-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [19].

elementList.name: Data Usage per PDU Session Report
Data Usage per QoS Flow List
Data Usage per QoS Flow Item

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: MR-DC Data Usage Report List
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the data usage.

elementList.name: Start timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [14]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: End timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [14]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: Usage count UL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

elementList.name: Usage count DL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of time reporting periods. Value is
  2.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
The UP Transport Layer Information IE
identifies an transport bearer associated to a DRB. It contains a Transport
Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address
is an IP address to be used for the user plane transport.

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This IE is used to provide the E1 control
plane transport layer information associated with an gNB-CU-CP and gNB-CU-UP
pair.

definitionList.name: GTP-TEID
descriptionList:
The GTP-TEID IE is the GTP Tunnel
Endpoint Identifier to be used for the user plane transport.

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [15].

definitionList.name: Transport Layer Address
descriptionList:
This Transport Layer Address IE is
an IP address.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the Transport Layer for interpretation. For details, see TS 38.414 [16].

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Information Request
descriptionList:
This IE
offers the possibility for the gNB-CU-CP to request data forwarding addresses
to the gNB-CU-UP. It also offers the possibility for the gNB-CU-CP to provide a
list of QoS flows subject to PDU Session level or DRB level data forwarding to
the gNB to which DRBs or QoS flows have been offloaded.

elementList.name: QoS Flows forwarded on the forwarding tunnel(s)
elementList.description: This IE contains information for which QoS flows forwarded data packets are sent on: - either the PDU Session forwarding tunnel (DL) - or the DRB forwarding tunnel (UL and DL).

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Information Response
descriptionList:
This IE
includes data forwarding information generated by the gNB-CU-UP upon request
from the gNB-CU-CP. Provides the forwarding information to the gNB from where
the DRB or QoS flow(s) have been offloaded.
